page.title: 01PEAT CUTTING
page.content: Edward Stuart is Tomintoul's local peat cutter.He has his own business of peat cutting and recently was cutting peat at the Feith Musach not very far north east of Tomintoul. The machines that he uses are a John Deere tractor with tracks and a peat plough,and three Massey Fergusons.He also has a lorry and a landrover. After he has cut the peat he has to leave it to dry which takes about 30 to 40 days.After drying they are picked up by hand and stacked in bags ready for selling.Over the winter he sells a lot of peat locally. The machinery that he uses can be very expensive so he has to be careful that he does not hit any stones when he is cutting the peat.The plough can cut to a depth of 3 feet and it makes the job a lot easier than doing it by hand.
